Nodes.Term

Class Term

  • java.lang.Object
    • Nodes.ASTNode
      • Nodes.Expression
        • Nodes.Term.Term
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    QLBoolean, QLFloat, QLString, Variable

    public abstract class Term
extends Expression

      Default implementation to get the corresponding Type enum for a Term.
      boolean isEqual(Term other)
      Every Term needs to implement this isEqual method so we can check equality except Variable, as those will never be passed to an Operator.
      void setParents(ASTNode parent)

      • setParents

        public void setParents(ASTNode parent)
        For Terms, only set the parent because it is a leaf of a tree
        Overrides:
        setParents in class Expression
        Parameters:

      • getTerm

        public Term getTerm()
             throws SyntaxException,
                    OtherException,
                    TypeException
        Return itself when Expression.getTerm() is called with a Term on one side It can throw a SyntaxExpression or OtherException when the override in Variable is called.
        Overrides:
        getTerm in class Expression
        Returns:
        The calculated value of the expression.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - when an Operator is not a valid Operator.
        OtherException - when a Variable isn't set yet.
        TypeException - when Types don't match.

      • getBoolean

        public boolean getBoolean()
                   throws TypeException
        Default implementations for every Term we allow in expressions.
        Returns:
        the boolean, float or string, depending on which method is called.
        Throws:
        TypeException - when the wrong method is called for a certain Term.

      • getFloat

               throws TypeException

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString()
                           throws TypeException

      • getType

        public Type getType()
             throws SyntaxException
        Default implementation to get the corresponding Type enum for a Term.
        Returns:
        A Type enum corresponding to the Term.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - when an invalid Term is used.

      • isEqual

        public boolean isEqual(Term other)
                throws TypeException
        Every Term needs to implement this isEqual method so we can check equality except Variable, as those will never be passed to an Operator.
        Returns:
        true or false, based on the equal operator.
        Throws:
        TypeException - when the Type aren't equal.
